ratings.question_text: The readings/cases/textbooks used in this course were __________ .
Out-of-class assignments for this course were ___________ to my learning.
The workload for this course in comparison to other courses was ___________.
The pace of this class was ____________ for optimal learning.
Field trips were well designed and ran smoothly.
I learned a lot from field trips.
How clearly does the instructor provide explanations of conceptual material?
How responsive to student comments was the instructor?
I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Apart from how well the course was taught, how valuable is the course to students with interests similar to yours?
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-14, if you wish
comments: I would not have taken the course if I'd known I would be given my third choice project. I was assigned to a project which played to my past professional experience, but I'm not at school to reinforce those skills, I'm here to push myself in new directions, andas such I was frustrated that I don't think I learnt anything new from the course.
Excellent project/client options. Conceptual material is light and external readings limited.

I think this course is very valuable. I'm only moderately interested in consulting, but the course gave me a chance to gain some hands-on experience working in my field of interest (energy efficiency). Maureen is great. She's very organized and responsive and I enjoyed our weekly meeting with her. She clearly has a ton experience in the consulting field and it shows.
Class was great!

narratives.question_text: What were the best aspects of this course?
comments: The opportunity to work with a real organization on a project I enjoyed. Plus getting to learn more about business and the environment and environmental consulting from leading voices in the fields.
I really liked the team that I got to work with and appreciated how organized Maureen was.
Practical experience, a very helpful professor. The fact that we got constant feedback from our group and classmates on how we were doing, how we could improve. etc.
The consulting projects were highly varied, but great learning experiences for students and clients.
Real-world consulting experience.

The best aspect of the course was the freedom my group had. Our client gave us very loose guidelines/parameters and we were free to go to work. Maureen is extremely easy to work with and does a great job inan adversarial role.
Prof. Burke was the best aspect of this course. I had a rather unfortunate client, but she helped my team weather the storm with ease, kind compassionate, and very reasonable and helpful guidance.
Consulting experience and great clients

narratives.question_text: What aspects of this course need the most improvement?
comments: Assessing the client beforehand to make sure that they would be a good fit for the clinic.
I thought it was a very clear cut course, with great speakers. Some of the speakers were obviously better than others, that can always use improvement.

Guest speakers... some were good, some weren't so good. I think I would have enjoyed hearing from speakers who manage the sustainability aspects of their companies, and what types of projects they work on. Ex: having Diageo come in was WAY more interesting than DEKRA, especially since we already had the other consulting company come by (which was much more informative than DEKRA, which seemed more like a start-up in its US operations).

Honestly, can't really think of any. The only possible suggestion I would make is too possibly have some sort of 2-semester project option. Our project felt a little rushed at time and it would have been nice to have 2 semesters to work on it.

I didn't really like most of the guest speakers. I actually liked Prof. Burke's lectures the most as they were clear and very goal-oriented. The take always from them were always helpful and easy to grasp, and I would've preferred to hear from Prof. Burke more often, rather than from guest lecturers.
Nothing

narratives.question_text: Was the relationship between the course lectures and discussion/lab section
comments: n/a
Nothing

narratives.question_text: Discuss, if you wish, how this course fits into your overall program.  (Please feel free to describe how the course relates to your academic background.)
comments: Fits as it helps me decide, practically, what kind of work I want to be doing once I graduate. Also taught me a lot about what it means to work for a client.

This course served as my capstone. I don't think my project was 100% what I had in mind in terms of what I wanted my capstone project to look like, but it was still a very good learning experience and our project was well received by our client.
I'm interested in energy efficiency and the course provided me a hands-on opportunity to work with a client who was interested in making energy efficiency upgrades at their company.
Fits very well with my professional development

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: Wanted to acquire new skills and work in a dynamic class setting
Practical experience before I look for a summer internship.Deciding if consulting is something I wanted to do with my life.
Capstone
To fulfill capstone requirement.
I took the course to gain hands-on experience working the energy efficiency field.
To fulfill my capstone requirement.
Professional Development

narratives.question_text: Did the knowledge/skills that you gained from the course meet your expectations ?
comments: Yes
Working in a group and working for a client.
Yes
Yes. I think my professional communication skills improved with this course. They certainly got a lot of exercise!
Yes and above

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: One of the best group projects I have ever experienced, partially because Maureen made it easy by setting clear expectations.

I was a little disappointed that my teammates were not second years. I felt there are a good number of courses we take as first years that help us hone inon quantitative/analytical skills, and my teammates did not have that...
Allowed more work to be completed in a semester. Improved quality of final deliverable.
It would have been impossible to tackle a project of this magnitude without help from my teammates. Teammates brought valuable experience/knowledge to the project. Enjoyed working with my team a lot.

This class is designed around group work. My group helped me understand the project conceptually and we pushed each other to move forward with timely progress. Getting a good group is somewhat luck of the draw, and I was fortunate to have a great group. I think if you exhibit the teamwork qualities you'd like to see from your team members, you'll be more likely to see those qualities from them.
Nothing everything was good

narratives.question_text: For students who might consider taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: Clients may not always turn out to be or act as you expected. Come with a willingness to be flexible and adapt.
Make sure you work on a project that has a good client. That can really make our break the experience.
Make sure you get assigned a project which is compatible with your educational objectives. Don't just do the course for the sake of it.
Take it during your 2nd year to get the most out of the consulting experience. Take time to think about your project preferences.
Format and presentation and crucial -- be glad for the opportunity to practice!
I would take this course even if you aren't interested in becoming a consultant. Do it if there is a project/client that interests you.

Take the class. Whatever your project is, you'll learn a lot about environmental consulting in action simply through the process of doing.Be thorough in your communications with both your client and Prof. Burke. She'll be best able to guide you when she had a clear picture of what's going on, and her guidance is very helpful indeed.
take it
